6800.name: The Coastal Bluffs
6800.description:
The highlands give way to windswept coastal bluffs overlooking a vast,
grey-green sea. Salt spray mists the air, and the crash of waves against
the cliffs far below creates a constant, thunderous rhythm. A winding
path descends along the bluff face toward a stretch of rocky shoreline.

north.description: The trail climbs back into the Eastern Highlands.

south.description: The path descends toward the shore.

6801.name: Rocky Shoreline
6801.description:
A stretch of dark, wave-smoothed rocks extends along the base of the
bluffs. Tide pools teem with small crabs and anemones, and strands of
kelp lie drying in the sun. The air is thick with the briny smell of
the sea. To the east, a ramshackle dock juts into the water.

east.description: A path leads to the old docks.

6802.name: The Smuggler's Dock
6802.description:
A weathered wooden dock extends over dark water, its planks slick with
algae and salt. Several small boats are tied up here, rocking in the
chop. Crates and barrels are stacked haphazardly nearby, some bearing
no merchant marks — smuggled goods, most likely. A rough tavern has
been built into the cliff face.

south.description: A pier extends further out over the water.

extra_descs.crates barrels:
The unmarked crates contain various goods — silks, spices, and bottles
of exotic liquor. Definitely not legitimate trade.

6803.name: Coastal Path
6803.description:
A narrow path hugs the cliff face, connecting the highlands above to
the coast below. Sea spray keeps the rocks perpetually wet, and tough
sea grass grows in every crack. The path is treacherous but passable,
with rope handholds driven into the rock at the worst spots.

north.description: The path climbs up to the highlands.

south.description: The path continues along the coast.

6804.name: Driftwood Beach
6804.description:
A crescent of grey sand littered with driftwood and the bleached bones
of sea creatures. The beach is sheltered from the worst winds by tall
rock formations on either side. Charred driftwood and empty bottles mark
where pirates have made camp. A cave mouth yawns in the cliff to the east.

west.description: The coastal path leads to the highlands.

east.description: A dark cave opens in the cliff face.

south.description: The beach narrows toward the reef shallows.

6805.name: The Outer Pier
6805.description:
The end of the pier extends over deeper water, dark and fathomless. Fish
swirl in schools below the planks, and a weathered fisherman's chair sits
at the end, bolted to the deck. A signpost has been nailed to a piling.

north.description: The dock leads back to shore.

extra_descs.signpost sign:
Scrawled in charcoal:
  'The temple lies beneath the waves to the south.
   Only fools and the desperate dive those waters.
   - Captain Blackhand'

6806.name: Tidal Cave Entrance
6806.description:
The cave mouth opens wide enough for three people abreast, but narrows
quickly. Water drips from stalactites and pools on the uneven floor.
The walls glisten with minerals, and bioluminescent algae provides a
faint blue-green glow. The tide line is clearly visible — this cave
floods regularly.

west.description: Daylight streams from the beach outside.

6807.name: Tidal Cave - The Grotto
6807.description:
The cave opens into a beautiful grotto, its ceiling studded with
glowing crystals that reflect in the still pool of seawater below.
Ancient carvings decorate the walls — depictions of a great temple
sinking beneath the waves. This place feels sacred, preserved by
the sea itself.

west.description: The cave leads back toward the entrance.

down.description: A flooded passage descends into darkness.

extra_descs.carvings walls:
The carvings show a magnificent temple dedicated to Nereus, god of the
sea. A great catastrophe — perhaps a tidal wave — swallowed it whole.
The final panel shows a glowing trident deep within the sunken ruins.

6808.name: Flooded Passage
6808.description:
You plunge into dark, cold water that fills the passage completely.
Bioluminescent creatures drift past like living stars, providing just
enough light to navigate. The passage slopes steeply downward, the
pressure building in your ears. Ancient stone blocks line the walls —
you're entering the outer ruins of the sunken temple.

up.description: The passage ascends to the grotto above.

down.description: The passage descends into the Sunken Temple.

6809.name: Reef Shallows
6809.description:
The water here is barely waist-deep, crystal clear over a reef of
vibrant coral. Tropical fish in impossible colors dart between the
coral heads, and sea urchins cling to every surface. The reef extends
far out to sea, creating a natural breakwater. Watch your step — the
coral is sharp as razors.

6810.name: The Reef's Edge
6810.description:
The reef drops away suddenly here into deep blue water. Standing on the
last shelf of coral, you can see down into an abyss where great shadows
move slowly in the depths. The current is strong, pulling toward the
open sea. To the southeast, volcanic smoke rises from a distant shore.

west.description: The shallow reef stretches back to shore.

east.description: A treacherous sea path leads toward volcanic shores.

6811.name: The Cliff Tavern
6811.description:
Carved into the cliff face behind the docks, this rough establishment
serves as both tavern and trading post for the coast's less reputable
visitors. Lanterns swing from the low ceiling, casting swaying shadows.
A scarred wooden bar runs along one wall, tended by a one-eyed barkeep
who asks no questions.

east.description: The door opens onto the docks.

6800.name: coastal pirate
6800.long_desc: A weathered pirate lounges here, cutlass at his hip.
6800.description:
This pirate has the look of a man who's spent his life at sea — sun-darkened
skin, salt-crusted clothing, and a missing finger on his left hand. His
cutlass is well-maintained despite his slovenly appearance.

6801.name: giant crab
6801.long_desc: A giant crab scuttles sideways across the rocks, claws clacking.
6801.description:
This crab is the size of a large dog, with a shell encrusted with barnacles
and claws that could sever a hand. It moves with surprising speed.

6802.name: smuggler
6802.long_desc: A shifty-looking smuggler eyes you suspiciously from the shadows.
6802.description:
This smuggler wears dark clothing designed to blend into the night. A
network of scars on his hands speaks to a life of knife-work and rope-burns.

6803.name: sea serpent
6803.long_desc: A serpentine form undulates through the water, scales gleaming.
6803.description:
This sea serpent is as long as three men laid end to end, with iridescent
scales and needle-sharp fangs. It moves through the water with terrifying
grace.

6804.name: old fisherman
6804.long_desc: An old fisherman sits mending his nets, humming a sea shanty.
6804.description:
This ancient fisherman has weathered more storms than he can count. His
knowledge of these waters is encyclopedic, and he's always willing to
share tales of the sunken temple beneath the waves.

6805.name: pirate captain
6805.long_desc: Captain Blackhand stands here, a fearsome figure in a tattered greatcoat.
6805.description:
Captain Blackhand earned her name from the black leather glove she never
removes from her right hand. Rumor has it the hand beneath is cursed —
or mechanical. She commands the smuggling operation on this coast with
an iron will and a sharp blade.

6800.name: pirate cutlass
6800.description: A curved cutlass with a tarnished brass guard and leather-wrapped grip.
